These days, there is a growing tendency that more and amore people choose to help the struggling strangers instead of neglecting them.

Some people may hold the opinion that it is meaningfulless to help a stranger, others, however, arguing that since we all be confronted with difficulties, we are supposed to help anyone who is in need.
From my perspective, I am convinced that help the struggling strangers plays an significant role in our daily life.
First and foremost, it is our instinct to help others who are in danger.
It is a commom sense that giving a hand to other people is a normal thing because everyone in the world may go through challenges.
What is more, we are educated to care for others and be kindful to all the people since we were children.
For example, if I see an old woman crossing the roads, what emerges on my mind first might be accompanying her carefully to pass the avenue.
Secondly, to help the struggling strangers stands for our enthusiasm to both the individuals and the society, from which we are able to nourish our mind and improve our social skills.
Bseides, having done such things, we will feel a sense of fufillment and peace, thus making us have a comprehensive understanding of morality and responsibility.
To be more accurate, if we help others without payback, we can not only recognize the importance of harmony but also understand how individuals affect the whole society.
Last but ont least, what we can not ignore is that the current social atmosphere motivates us to help strangers who are faced with hardships.
For an instance, there are so many billboards, posters, and slogans around our cities to appeal our attention to be helpful to others.
Bseides, evne though what we have done might be so tiny that  it cannot change a person's life, we indeed convert our kindness and warmth to them so that they can feel our love.
What is more, by helping others we have more opportunities to hook up with new friends and abroaden our horizons.
To put it in a nutshell, it is our obligation to help the struggling strangers.
Only by this way that we are able to create a harmonious environment and make our life more wonderful and prosperous!
In recent years, parents are likely to award their children for high marks they got in shcool.
As a senior high shcool student, I think this is a win-win idea.
From my perspective, study can be boring and tiring sometimes.
In this way, students may need some encouragement to help them get through the difficulties they face when study, it's not a easy thing anyway.
And gradually your children begin to have their own hobbies that they won't tell you somehow, so you may not know what to buy to encourage them.
In this way, they may need money as a form of award.
Only if they get the money in their own pocket can they make the use of it in a way they would like.
On the one hand offering your shool-age children money for each grade mark they get in school can satisfy them and give them ample energy to study in the future and do their best in the meantime.
And it also gives your children a kind of feeling of success.
And as they grow older they will have to manage their own money, so why not start now?
Your children can find a way to manage their own money and make good use of them.
So in the future, when they have to live on their own, they won't spend money without a plan.
And they may do the management of money better than the person who didn't get money when they got a high mark in shcool.
On the other hand, once they got money, they will continue to study harder in the future because they know if they don't do so, they may not get money again.
Once they have got used to study hard and do things trying theri best, they will keep on doing like this.
As a consequence, when they enter the university, they won't find themselves wondering all day not knowing what to do, instead they will learn a lot by themselves, which can enrich their lives.
In all, from my point of view, it can be a brilliant idea to offer school-age children money for high grade they get in schoo.
Nowadays, more and more parents think when their kids get a good grades at school, they should be given some present like money.
But I think it is not the best present for kids.

Although when your child get a good grade at school is a fantastic thing to you, you will be prond of your child, you can give other things like a big dinner or a book which child maybe like it, but money is not suitable for child.
Because if child get money, they will buy something which are not helpful for their health like chips, childs cannot identify the goods are good for them or bad for them.
Actually, chidren do not have ability to protect their money.
When they meet some people who want to cheat them to get their money, they cannot find and give the money to these people.
Also when children who are paying for something, a bad teenagers who want to get money will follow them.
When the people on street is less the bad teenagers will stop the children and bit them.
In the end, the bad guys get the money and children be broken.
The third reason is, children cannot control their unlimited wants becuse they do not know how the money is difficult to get.
So they will pay it at anywhere they want.
For example, if something which they want to get they can afford it, whatever how expensive the thing it is, they will buy it to achieve their wants.
So in my opinion, when children do well at school course, parents can get them to a huge restraunt or an ammusement park to let them feel well to get good grades.
But please remember, money is the thing which chidren are not suitable to have.
When the children get monry, there are many difficult problems  which parents should solve them.

I don't think that it's a good idea for parents to reward their children with money for high grade in school.
First, I think there's not only money that matters for the children.
School-age children need much more things than money such as love and care.

There's a very common case in remote places of China that both parents, or only one of them, go out to work for higher income, leaving their child at home alone, which has become a big issue of the nation.
Those children are at a higher risk of bad performance in school and even have a higher crime rate because of the lack of care, though they may get money from their parents for high mark.
What are the difference between those who give their children money and those who work out?
Second, being offered money in school will make the students feel like working, while in fact, school is a very different place from work.
In working places, people get paid because of their contribution to the society, but in school, it's the students' duty to learn.
Knowledge and acedemy should be pure, at least in primary and middle school.
Student should learn for knowledge, rather than money.
It's true that this method can raise the interest of some students to study, but it also has its side effect.
Giving students money would give them a sence that it's their right not to study well, because they sould suffer the unpayment and that is the cost.

Last, instead of offering money, I recommend that parents give their children some other things for good performance, such as time to play together, toys the child wants and other things, as long as you can make a bargin.
And money can be offered as pocket money instead of reward.

Recently, an interesting question has aroused a heated debate among public: whether teachers should be paid at much as doctors, lawyers or business leaders are paid.
Answers vary from person to person.
Some people claim that teachers should be paid much.
However, I strongly believe that teachers should not  get so much salary.
My point can be elaborated as follows.
First of all, paying so much salary to teachers may cause a huge increase in students schooling cost, which is hard to match for some poor families.
Doctors and lawyers are paid a lot, and a school has many teachers.
If all of these teachers need so much money, it is sure that the school cannot pay for them by itself, the school must charge a large part of this money from students.
Students whoes family is not rich may drop out.
In the contrast, if teachers get a relative low salary, the schools and pay for them by itselves.
For example,  my  high school' teacher were paid 3000 yuan per month in averange and each year we students only need to hand on 700 yuan for our texbook.
Second, unlike doctors, lawyers and business leaders, teachers can earn money by help several students besides their schooling work.
Students in rich families or do not well in some certen subjects may find teachers to help them one by one and teachers will charge for these kind of help.
With people put more and more attention on their children' education,  pariends having econmocial ability are willing to pay of teachers.
For instance, I  did bad on may math class when I was in high school, and my mother really worried about me.
So she let a math teacher help my and paid 300 for every class.
To put it in a nutshell, I firmly believe that teachers should not be paid as much as doctors, lawyers and business leaders are paid.
This is not only because students should send more money if it is but also because teachers can easily get more money by doing some part time teaching.
I am the opponent of the idea that parent should allow children make mistakes and let them learn from it.
I have some reasons.
First, after making mistakes can them have an inpressions on what is right or what is wrong.
Take my own experience as instance.
When I was young I have a passion on the perfume of alcohol.
So every time my grandpa is drinking i climbed to get close to him and beg for some to taste,  you know, just to taste but not to drink.
Of cource, my grandpa know it is not good for my health.
So after some day when eating meals, I begged for wine as usual.
But this time my grandpa give a glass of wine and let me imbibed the whole.
What funny, as a consequence, I was shocked by the taste of alchol and from that time I never want to drink wine.
If my grandpa didn't let me drink the whole glass of wine, I wouldn't get aware of the hot of the alchol, and I will not know the impact of wine.
On top of that, I think after children make mistakes, parents should instruct their children.
In this way, kids can develop an correct reaction towards mistakes instead of depression.
I heard a story of a father take his son to travel.
The father is a genial father.
Every time when the son make mistakes or encounter some difficulties, he wil help his son.
One day they visited a lake, on the boat, the camera fell into the water because of the carefullness of the child.
The son was frightend with such a incident.
He worried his father would beat him, so he fell into depression.
But surprisingly, without shouting at his son, the father feel a little pity at first.
But after a moment, the father comforted his son, he said it was OK, he will buy a new  one for him, but the child should know how he made such a mistake.
After the instruction, the son admitted his fault and felt happy again.
We should admit that it is not the mistake  but the instructions that matters.
Finally, parents should let their children  make mistakes.
Only by doing mistakes and let them take the risk and solve the problem themselves can they grow up swiftly.
Making mistakes is not frightened.
Just let kids know what is right or what is wrong and find their own way to solve the problem can  they become more indepandant.

Currently, a controversial topic has aroused heated debated: whether teachers should be paid at least as much as doctors, lawyers or business leaders are paid.
Opinions vary from people to people.

Some claim that teachers should get the equivalent salary as the doctors, lawyers or business leader, since they play an important role in the growth of children and devote lots of time and energy to promote comprehensive abilities of their students.
However, I hold an opposite view that teachers should not get the same wage as doctors, lawyers or business lawyer, because the decreasing significance on students.
First off, there are lots of resources on-line to substitute teachers and teachers become less importance.
To illustrate, with the appearance of diversity of technological gadgets, students can get access to the knowledge from coding and their major informations to language learning and basic development.
Teachers are not indispensible in the students' education any more.
Besides, the public courses on line is much more cheaper than the tutor fee.

In contrast, the doctors needs long time experience of diagnosing the disease; the lawyers needs to have excellent presentation skills and the ability of collecting evidences; the business leaders need to have outstanding organized ability and assign proper jobs for each one based on their ability and characters.
All of these jobs cannot be substitued by advanced technology.
In this case, teachers shouldn't be paid at least as much as doctors, lawyers or business leaders.
Additionally, the increasing engagement in their kids' education by modern parents, resulting the decreasing importance of teacher.
To elaborate, with the increasing of masses' affluence, more and more parents are aware of the importance of education in their kids' future and pay more attention on their kids' education.
The time and energy that teachers devote on their students are taken place by students' parents.
For one thing, at home, parents spend lots of time to work with their kids, review their homework, supervise them to preview textbooks and guarantee their attendence on time.

For another, at school, parents serves as members of teacher conference commitment, organize all kinds of activities such as basketball game and singing competition in order to cultivate their leisure hobby.
Under this circumstance, there is no reason that teachers should get the equal salary as doctors, lawyers, and business leaders.
By contrast, lawyers,doctors and business leaders are still required to put their all energy and time on their work and these jobs are very important in modern society.

To put it in a nutshell, teachers should not be paid at least as much as doctors, lawyers or business leader, since the role in students' education is decreasing and they are substituted by resources on-line and parents.

Recently, an interesting topic has aroused a heated debate among public: which has more influence on your happiness, your job or social life.
The answer varies from person to person.
From my perspective, I believe that the job definetly has a more positive effect on our happiness.
To begin with, the salary from the job would makes us happy.
As we know, most of people are trying to search for a decent job in order to improve their life quality, which means they have ability to purchase what they want to buy.
In this case, once they spend their salary on the product which they are dreaming for a long time, they are more likely to receive a sence of satisfaction.
On the contrary, people cannot get money from their social life even they have to arrange their budget on social life so they cannot get happy from there.
For example, my sister works on the high school as a teacher.
Last week she told me she have ability to afford a Coach purse because she saved her salary for it for a long time.
At the moment she bought the purse, I could see a big smile on her face.
Furthermore, the accomplishment that is attained in the work allow people to feel glade.
This is because in the work people cannot avoid dealing with some tough work arranged by their boss.
It can be imagine that through struggling for the hard job by overworking, once they finish it they will receive a huge sense of accomplishment.
Without doubt, the gratification makes people happy.
On the contrary, social life is less likely to give people a tough job so people will not get happiness from it.
For example, last week, my mom dedicated her much time on a project of her company for a week and she have never come home before 9 pm.
However, after she finished that project flawlessly, she felt she did a great job and so happy that invite our family to congratulate with her.
To sum up, the job exert more effect on people's happiness than social life does.
This is because people can spend their salary on their dreaming products and receive a sense of accomplishment.

Nowadays, some parents come up with the idea to award their children for getting high grade in school.
They think it is a way to encourage their children to study harder in school.
As far as I can see, this kind of action might be effective for a short term, but the influence on children might be negative in long term.
The children are meant to go to school and study, all the efforts they paid are for themselves, not for money or their parents.
They are too young to understand that, but parents should lead them to think like that.
By awarding children money for getting high grades, the kids might think they are studying for the money, and that might change their values.
The influence is long term, and the impact could be significant.
Let me give an example, it is like training a dog.
You are training you dog to sit down, you would award him with a treat when he sits, and several times of training, he would sit once you tell him to.
That seems good on dogs, but when it comes to humans, the actions you take should be different, since you certainly can not treat a man like a dog.

When you are taking this awarding actions, the kids are just like the dogs, they are trained to study hard for the awards, not for the knowleges, and once the awards are no longer given, their passion for studying is gone.

I do admit that the children need encouragement to study hard, because they do not have the passion to study, but we certainly should not transfer their passion to money, that would cause a big changing on their values, and that is not what we want in a long term sight.
I think we can find other ways to encourage children to study.
Nowadays the purchase has been a concern for many people and it causes a topic that which factor affects people the most when it comes to a major purchase.

This debate divdes people with different camps with different opinions, and some people would like to hold the opinion that the information from media or sales man in the market will influnen their purchase the most.
However, when it comes to me, I consider ercommendations from my friends or colleagues will affect my purchase the most, and there are some reasons and examples that can illustrate my opinions.
First and foremost, people are likely to trust their frineds more.

To be more specific, since people have been spending so much time with their frineds, and there are no finacial benifits between them about the recommendations of purchasing, their frineds will be sincere to them and they are more likely to hear their friend's advice.

In opposition, if people just view the information from media, they will probably get misleaded since the media may perfer them to buy something that people actually don't need at all since the media has to get its own benefits.

For example, one of my best friends, who likes shop a lot, he will always get information from me since he trusts me that I can tell him whether he really needs to buy this product, and I will be willing to tell him sincerely since it will not bring benefit or cost moeny.
In the second place, people's friends known what kind of product best fits them.

This is because that frineds are based on common interest, so they will talk about the same things a lot and get to know more about each other, and their friends know what they like the most and what fit them the most, as a result of this, their friends' advice will always favor them and they will be more likely to turn to their friends for advice.
In opposition, if people just listen to the salesman in the market, they may buy something that don't fit them at all since the salesman cannot tell what fits them the most and what they like.

Let's take myself for example, I will talk a lot about clothes with my frineds, so they will get to know what fits me and what I like the most, in this way every time when I turn to me for advice, they can always give me an advice that satisfy me.

Granted, it may be reasonable and attractive that some people claim that information from media or salesman in the market affects the purchase the most, since the media is everywhere and will easily get people's attention so people will get affected easily, and the salesman has very good speech that can convince people.

However, it cannot hold water, since people are likely to hear their sincere friends, so after hearing the advice from their friends, they can know for sure what they actually need, so they will neither be affected by the information form media nor the salesman in the market.
So I am still convinced by my standpoint that the recommendations from my friends can affect purchase the most.

Have you ever noticed that the major audiences of a concert hold by a famous singer are always youger people?
The phenomenon I metioned before can decribe the opinions of celebrities, such as the well-known entertainers and sportsman are more significant to younger generation than they are to older people.
There are multitude of reasons to explain this kind of phenomenon.
Firstly, younger generation are more likely to be addictted by those famous people.
Secondly, younger people have less experience to let them hold their own opinion and do not change by other's statement.
First of all, because younger people are more in-style, they can get more fashionable things than older people, so they are more interested in these kind of people.
For instance, nowadays, there are a lot of well-known stars who are very handsome and fashionable, and they have a huge numbers of fans, which are almost teenagers or university students.
They may care more about those fresh things and those gorgeous people.
If they are really addictted into these stars, firstly they will follow the trend that the idol has, after that, they will buy the products that the entertainer recommend.
With the time is going, the opinions of their idols are very significant to them.
What is more, some of the younger generation who follow the celebrities are under 18, so that they do not have very mature value to judge or analyse those things happened.
When I was a little girl, if I had something that I can not handle, I would  choose to ask a person who I admired or appreciated for their help.

If the younger generation are fond of those celebrities, they will consider the opinions from those celebrities very carefully, because they have nothing to do but follow the person that they believe.
On the other hand, for older people, they may have their own thought and perspective for the things happened surroungding them, so they can handle and deal with it though the experience they have.
In conclusion, the views of well-known people are more vital to yonnger generation than they are to older people.
At present, a controversial topic has aroused a heated debate among students: should people focus on the realistic goals rather than ambitious ones?
Answers vary from one to another.
Some people claim that it's more important to set up an ambitious dream.
However, contrary to their view comes to my own perspective that people should pay more attention to the realistic goals.
My viewpoint is based on following views.
First,  we can find methods easily with a realistic goal.
To be more specific, a realistic target is more concrete and easier to make specific plans to achieve it.
In this way, by dividing the goals into smaller parts, people can easily handle this small particle one by one with corresponding  method.
However, if you set up an ambitious goal, you may even not know how to start for everthing is so abstract.
For example, my brother Jack managed to build up a Internet company after his graduation.
He made a detailed list that recorded everything he needed to open up a company such as conputers, printers, desks and so on.
And he also listed up all expenses needed in his notebooks.
In this way, he converted a difficult task---opening up a company into smaller parts---things he needed, expenses and other stuff, which made the goal more easier to achieve.
Second, a realistic goal could elevate people's enthusiam.

Specifically, people usually find a concrete goal more likely to ahieve than an ambitious one for they always think they don't qualify for some extremely hard work but if they are asked to head toward a more specific task, they may be cheered up and then enthusiastic to finish the task.
Take myself for an example.
My boss once asked me to hand in the outline of the economic situation of recent years in one week for he will use in the meeting.
I thought it so hard that the economic situation has included so many aspects and I ecen didn't know where to start.
After being informed that the outine was used to describe the situation of restaurants, I found more energetic and finished it soon.
In conlusion, people should focus on the realistic goals rather than ambitious ones for the realistic goals are easier to achieve and can also raise people's enthusiam
In this fast developing society, education is becoming more and more important.
Whenever asked about the attitude towards the question that whether parents should allow children make mistakes and let them learn these mistakes, people always exist an air of uncertainty.
However, I wholeheartedly agree that children should make mistakes and then learn from the mistakes without parents help.
First, by making mistakes and learn from them without parents' help, children can learn to be independent.
If parents don't help children when they make mistakes, then children will know that they should depend on themselves because they have no other persons to rely on.
Therefore, they will try to solve the problems by themselves and learn from the mistakes.
In this way, they will do the whole process by themselve, and the next time they make mistakes, they will not try to rely on others, they will just learn from the mistakes.
So, letting children make mistakes and learn from them will help children to be independent.
Then, letting children make mistakes and learn from them, can let them prepare for the future.
Children often are kept away from the problems, so they never have the chance to see what the real world is like.
However, the real world is not as amazing as they think, so by letting them make mistakes, they will get to know that there are a lot of chanllenges in the real world.
And when they become a member of the society, they will make mistakes.
So,let them learn from their own mistakes when they are children, they will become used to the future when they enter the society and make mistakes.
In this way, letting them make mistakes and learn from the mistakes can let them prepare for the future.
Last but not the least, by letting children make and learn from mistakes, children will understand their parents more.
Parents alway tell their children what to do and not to do in order to give them a bright future.
However, children sometimes can not understand that their parents do so because their parents about them.
So, when children make mistakes without parents suggestion, they will know that parents are right.
And when they try to learn from their own mistakes, they will not that it is not a easy task.
Therefore, they will know that what parents said is to to keep them away from mistakes and give them helps.
So they will undertand their parents.
To conclude, only if parents let children make and learn from their own mistakes, can children learn to be independent, be prepared for the future and understand their parents.
Children have a natural instinct,which is called encouragement mechanism.

Admittedly, young people today are able to make better decisions about their own lives compared with the previous stage, although it is hard to judge which decision is better or more reasonable, the people today do have better decision making skills.
Evidently, people have more ways to gain access to the knowledge and information, we are no longer rely on the inderect experiences of our ancestors.

Moreover, in the rapid development of the world, everything is undergoing earthshaking chages at any time, it is hard to recognize the useful and valuable information, which make it harder to form our decision making skills.

Above all, it does not really matter how to make decisions better, what's more important is that the young people have the ability to analyze the problems by their own and make more reasonable and acceptable decisions.

In this day and age, a huge number of events involved juvenile deliquency from school bullying to campus violence are emerging.
Hence, a favorable method to handle these tricky problems is extremely demaned.

And there are many various measures are proposed, many citizens assert that the most efficient way is to supervise and monitor children, and others contends that parents are supposed to limit the types of the pograms and movies.
However, I have a profound conviction that the ideal approach for parents is to accompany with their children.
First of all, children's many false beviour occure due to the lacked commucation.
This is because if kids can obtain a valuable opportunity convey their thoughts to others, childeren will perfrom better with parent's guide.
To illustrate, never will the passage of time gnaw away my memory.
When I was young, my parents were busy with their work.
That is to say, they only said less than 5 sentences to me every week Thereby, in order to lead my parents pay more attention on me and create more chance to commuciate with me.
I always fighted with other children and participated in school shooting.
Had my parents been willing to spend more time talking with me, I would have not acted badly.
On top of that.
the approach to limit the types of the TV programs and movies children watch is incorrect, since it is likely to stifle children's creativity and innovation.
Fo instance, there are many knowledge on the TV programs or movies that adloescents could obtain.
With the help of these knowledge, it is extremely for them to creative many interesting items.
Last but not the least, it is time-consuming for parents to supervise and monitor children while they are playing others.
In addition, once the method is implemented, parents are hardly to work in their regular time.
In conclusion, I believe that parents should spend time with children.

In our competetive life, there are more and more cooperation existing in the society.
And certainly, the leader of a team plays an importanta role in working.
Here comes a question.
Some people think a team leader should listen to the advice of the members, while others think they should not.
In my opinion, I insist a team leader is supposed to listen to its members.
First, listening to members of the team can help to create more ideas which may be more creative and effective.
I have to admit that most leaders are more capable and smart, but it does not mean they are always the best.
This makes me think of an experience of mine.
When I was in high school, I thought I had a great idea to solve the math question facing a difficult question.
As I was the leader of the group, I wanted to answer the teacher for the first one, so I did not discuss with mt group members.
Unfortunately, after my answering, other group gave a better answer which have be thought of by one of my group member.
It was a pity that I did not listen to my team members.
Secondly, listening to other is a kind of communication, which can makes the circumustance of the team more friendly.
And most member are willing to try their best, which means they can improve the efficiency of the team work.
Once I was engaged in a electronic device competetion, and my group did not make any progress but discussing, and that made me very nervious about the contest.
But my team leader insisted to listen to members about the idea such as conducting methods, designing plan, and time arranging.
And all of my team members are willing to give their suggestions.
Altough we did not do much at the first stage, I find we beyonded other team suprisingly at last.
That made me realize listening to members can aviod many problems which is much harder to solve in the following stage.
Thirdly, there is no doubt that making decision without listening to members can be more efficient sometimes.
Because there are so many things which is emergency, the team leader have no time discussing with the group.
However, the leader often just think it is not necessary to have a communication.
In order to deal with this problem, I think leaders should hold regular meeting to listen to their members.
In this case, the leader do not need to listening to others in some special situations.
And finally, listening to members are so important that a team may be destoried by the lack of communication.
So listening is very significat,

Recently, an interesting question has aroused a heated debate among people: whether teachers should be paid at least as much as doctors, lawyers or business leaders or not.
Some people hold the idea that it is not reasonable to give teachers as least the same salary as doctors, lawyers or business leaders.
However, as far as I am concerned, teachers should be paid more salary.
My point will be illustrated as follows.
First of all, teachers,who make a significant part of society, deserve a good salary.
As is known to all, education is the foundamention of a society, and teachers are the independable part of education.
It means that the quanlity of teachers determines a country's future.
They are as important as doctors,lawyers or business leaders to the society.
Thus we need to give those good salary to them to represent their importance and encourage them to do better.
I can remeber that my uncle was a math teacher in high school.
He used to get nearly 5000 a month three years ago and he always felt bored about the job, nevertheless, his salary raised to 10000 because of the educational reform.
And since then, he put more energy in teaching and felt it stimulating, eventually he became a good teacher in the school.
Becides, increasing the teachers' salary can encourage more people to become a teacher, which can ease the educational pressure where there are few teachers in some poor regions.
China still has some really poor villages, and youngsters would not like to go there because of the tough environment and low salary.

Nevertheless, if the government can increase the teachers' salary to as least as much as doctors, lawyers of business leaders, I believe there must be more people would like to be teachers in those areas.
To put it in a nutshell, I agree with the idea that teachers should be paid more and at least as much as doctors, lawyers or business leaders.

in contrast, as a doctor,if your patient does not feel satisfied about your medical ways or healing ways.
If he told his annoy to your boss, and you will suffer from some blame from your boss.
Even your payment will be decreased.
For instrance, my aunt is also a teacher like my mother.

It's vrey common nowadays that  parents reward their kids with money, usually for good performance at school, because they think it can motivate and dirve their kids to face those eldless homework and boring class.
But, is this a really good idea?
I doubt it very much.
First, using money as reward will make kids feel that study is a kind of goods exchange, which is harmful for their value about study.
Once kids realize that they can earn money just by studying and getting good grades, they will begin to take study as a kind of job--parents are the bosses, and they are the employees.
Then they will study hard for profits and "salary" instead of knowlegy and skill.
In that way, study becomes a burden and task for them.
They won't get the true meaning and goal of study.
But in fact, study is for their own benefit and it's a good preparation for their life.
Besides, getting money as reward will lead the kids to become more material.
They will think that money is more important than anything else because their parents' behavior indicated that.

Situations as follows may happen as time goes by: when you ask your son to fetch today's newspaper for you, he will imediately reply "one dollar"; when you ask him to wash dishes or sweep the floor, he may answer:  " You have to pay me".
How horrible it is!
School kids tend to be influenced easily by their surroundings, especially the behavior of their parents.
So good expample is more important than the results.
Finally.
I think this kind of stratedy or tactics has represented the deep concern or worry of parents.
They care too much about their kids' grades and rank.
They have tried many ways to push or force kids to get good grades but failed.
So money as reward become an alternative choice for them, although they known it maybe unwise.
As I see, the best way to encourage your kids is communication and praise.
From my perspective, I strongly believe the statement that relating well to people is more crucial than studing hard in school.
First and foremost, most of jobs in modern society require your social network.
Take my cousin as an example.
My cousin who has been working in marketing field for 5 years longer has to socialize with different sort of people.
Hence, those people in her social network will introduce her to some potential customers who her friends get along with well.
Gradually, her worked better and get more promotion than other collegues who lack of relatively rich social relationhips.
In addition, cultivating the capatity to interact with others sometimes bring you efficiency when you are working in a group.
My classmate Kay's eloquence is quiet outstanding.
She was required to be a hoster and take part in a group in order to prepare a show.

These days, a controversial topic has aroused a heated debated among people: whether government should hire more police to improve the safety to attract tourist.
Some claims that the safety if the base so this action is necessary, others shows that government should pay more attention on other aspects.
Opinions vary from person to person.
From my perspective,  My point will be elaborated as follows.
Firstly, government should concentrate more on the environment and the protection on the scenic area to attract the tourists.
The main propuse of the travel is to appreciate the beautiful landscape and experience the local culture, so protect the scenery should be the top priority of the government.
Only if the environment can give the tourists a relaxing atmosphere, can more people come and experience it.
On the countrary, although the safety issue can be guranteed by the police, the dirty environment an d the none typical landscape would have no attraction to the tourists.

For example, I went to Hawaii last summer, though i know that i would never suffer from robbary or other crimeï¼Œthe dirty beach and rubbish on the seaside left a bad impression on me, and also the sea is not as blue as the describition in the advertisment.
Consequently, I made a early termination of my vacation.
Secondly, the friendly attitude and the warm welcom of  local people can play an important role in attracting tourists.
Receiving a warm welcome, people would keep a high spirits and would pay more attention to admire the culture and the scenery.
On the other hand, imaging that if the travelers are heated by the local people or received a bad service, they wouldnot come back again.

For example, my roommates went to Japen last year, he received fine services with waiters take care of his daily life including the schedual of breakfast and dinner, and also the landscape he should visit on each day of his trip.
Opposite to the last country he visited: India, where the local people think that his trip have a bad influence on their daily life, he spent more time on Japon.
All in all, government can pay more attention on other aspects to attract people.
It is undenible that parents should teach their children, however, the problem is which way is a best chioce for them to impart knowledge to their children.
From my prospective, I agree with the point that parents need let children make mistake and let then learn from their own mistakes.
Also, beside this mentioned above, a lot more should be done by parents, telling their children the reasons why they have done wrong and why they should fix it.
First, the reason why parents should let children make mistake is obvious that children should not be trapped, while they have their own chioce to do what they want.
As a human nature, children are free to choose and think, that is of great importance to their growth and mental improvement.
While they make their own mistake, they are able to bear the result from what they have done.
And unceasingly, they will find the rule about what they should do and what they should not, as a self-awareness growth which is a positive significance for children.
Then, not only parents should let their children make mistakes and learn from it by their own, but also a nessesary instruction need to be done by parents.
As a matter of fact, many children indeed have made many mistake, however, sometimes, they are not able to solute the problems by their own, when they are faced with big trouble.
That situations need the participation of parents, who play an important role on this sense.

Take the learning ride as an example, when a child is falling from the bike, parents is surely able to encourage their child to be confident and do it once again, and parents can let he know which point should be paid more attention duiring the ride time, such as keeping the balance or so.
In that way, this child will definitely do better.
Therefore, taking everything mentioned above, parents is overwhelmingly responsible for the children's growing states.
And they not ony need to lat children make mistakes and let them learn from theit own mistakes, but also need to give the right instruction to them.

Nowadays, celebeities are well known to most of us and they have a great impact on us when we grow up.
There is a heated discussion on who is more affected by celebrities such as athletes and well-known entertainers, younger people or older people?
From my perspective, celebrities will influence more on younger people.
First of all, younger people are more familiar with atheletes and entertainers.
They know their stories and are certain to be affected.
On the contrary, most older people do not have interest in celebrities, for most of them have no access to get to know celebrities.
There are no television or network when they grew up.
Second, many celebrities are very young, as a result of which, older people may not want to be influenced for they experience more and have a deeper understanding about life.
However, younger people have less eperience and eager to digest celebrities' opinion in order to make more wise decision in the future.
So younger people are more will to listen to celebrities.
Last but not least, even there are networks around the world, most older people do not know how to use the phone and get in touch with the internet.
Therefore, they may not even know what celebrities say although they know who they are.
Most younger people today use internet and read news everyday.
They know what is going on around the world and the words said by celebrities.
Nowadays, some parents are offering money for prize when they have a excellent academic performance.
Some parents deem that it will be a motivation to their children to work hard to maintain a high score.
While others do not think so.
They hold the view that doing well in schoolwork is the essence of a student's duty while linking study with such meterial rewards may have a bad effect in cultivating their interest in studies.
As far as I am concerned, a propriate reward has more advantages rather than drawbacks.
First of all, offering money for high grade is the most direct way to approve their children's hardwork in studies.
Take my little brother as an example.
He wants to buy some vedio games to play.
However, the price is quite expensive.
So he made an agreement with his mother that if he get a high score in the middle term exam, he can get the funding from his mother.
To obtain his goal, he became queit and deeply absorbed in preparing the exam.
It turns out that this agreement inspires him to work hard to fufill his desire.
On top of that, children can be taught with a lesson that only if you work hard, you wll get wht you want.
Admittedly, education should mainly focus on inspring student's will in acquiring knowledge in a long term and prizes like money may mislead children's thoughts.
However, humans are to some extent resisted to things that require more efforts and how can we really get ineterted at the very begining if there are not so attractive comapring to other things?

Try to approve children in the simplest way and teach them thwe lesson about hard work leads to prizes or success when they get older, it is surely the sound idea when you have trouble deciding on how to motive your children in studying hard.

As we all know, these days, cooporation is a important thing.
Everyone needs this.
So when teachers assign projects on which students must work together, some people think they will not have a chance to think about them own things so they don't want to work with others.

However, in my opinion, I think the students will learn more by finishing a same task with others or share their idea with one another, which will let them develop the ability of group's cooporation and learning from others.
First of all, that studying in a group is just like working in a company, students can learn how to share out your work and work out one task with others.
For example, I was asked to finish a research after class, and the teacher let us to find three or four partners to do the research together.
We didn't know why she'll let us do that because the task is easy to work out, but we did.
And then, when we worked together, everyone could feel teacher's smart with surprise.
We dividid the one part of the research to one student and did it on one own.
And finally, we finished the research very fast.
Secondly, students can also learn from their partner during ideas partake.
In a word, students will learn much more effectively when they study together than when they are asked to work alone on the projects.
